snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu devoted the first part of his speech to the General Assembly to a harsh denunciation of the accord with Iran.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu, in fiery speech at United Nations, strongly criticizes nuclear agreement with Iran, saying it does not block Iran's path to building nuclear weapons; although Netanyahu says clearly that United States is a favored and strong ally, delegates from United States remain silent during speech.

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone reported from New York, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu devoted the first part of his speech to the General Assembly to a harsh denunciation of the accord with Iran.

headline.main: Benjamin Netanyahu, at U.N., Continues to Condemn Iran Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu, at U.N., Assails Iran Deal
